attributes.action: Create a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather
attributes.background: We all know that the public holidays in the UK are unevenly distributed and usually coincide with periods of very poor weather. We can't blame the government for that, however, we do have the power to change it!
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of having two 'bank' holidays in May, we should designate an alternative one day 'Met Office' day every year. This would not be a day that the Met Office gets to chill out, but a day that is designated at short notice when the 'experts' at the Met Office are confident that we will all be able to light the BBQ and actually make the most of time with family and friends. 

In summary, exchange one of the May Bank Holidays for a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather.

attributes.action: Guarantee the estimated £3.8 million of HLS funding for the New Forest.
attributes.background:
There will be a £3.8 million gap in funding for the New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme for 2019 and 2020 once the UK officially leaves the EU.

The scheme is vital to protecting the New Forest's unique environment. That's why we're calling on the government to continue funding the scheme.
attributes.additional_details:
The New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme is a formal partnership between the Verderers, the Forestry Commission and the New Forest National Park Authority.

It has:
Restored miles of internationally-important habitats for wildlife
Supported the historic practice of commoning, which maintains the unique Forest landscape
Worked to identify & protect historic sites

New Forest Commoners: http://www.nfcda.com/news--meetings.html
Official page: http://www.hlsnewforest.org.uk/hls/site/index.php

attributes.action: Start schools later
attributes.background: Make schools start and finish later so students can concentrate better

attributes.action: Call For A 2nd EU Referendum If A Good EU Withdrawal Agreement Cannot Be Made
attributes.background: The United Kingdom voting to leave the European Union triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. We want to decide if we should remain part of the European Union based upon the nature of the withdrawal agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
A Brexit triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. The European Council will conclude the this withdrawal arrangement based upon a qualified majority vote. A large portion of the United Kingdom electorate were misled into believing a favourable withdrawal agreement is relatively certain. 

We believe in informed democracy. We believe that we the British people should be able to decide whether or not our country leaves the EU based upon facts that we can confirm. Not contingent truths.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Remove Council Tax Payments for families earning below £22000 a year.
attributes.background: Council tax is forever growing year upon year. With each new financial tax year we see it rise by a percentage every year. When will it become tone expensive to pay. Why do we have to pay such high tariffs. NOW is the time to help struggling families who scrape every penny together.

attributes.action: Pair schools here with school in developing world to send over technology.
attributes.background: In order to help implement resources to help out children in the developing world we think that by donating technology we can make a difference to their lives. For example, a computer could help give children an insight in different opportunities available

attributes.action: Have a cross party panel run the nhs rather than the government.
attributes.background: A cross party panel could make long term decisions for the nhs rather than the government making short term decisions based on their political ideology, popularity and what will keep the government in power.

attributes.action: Carers leave for those in full time employment to care for an immediate relative
attributes.background: Having seen the NHS crisis it is clear that most of the problem is "bed blocking" patients who's treatment is complete but cannot go home as there is no home care in place. Instead of waiting for Social care to be sorted. It would be preferable for a relative to be allowed paid leave.
attributes.additional_details: This could become a right in the same way as maternity leave. Used for short term care to relieve strains on social care as has recently been disclosed on News media.

attributes.action: guarantee all EU football players be exempt from net migration targets
attributes.background: Parliament needs to guarantee that in the forthcoming Brexit negotiations there will be provision made for the free movement of all EU football players to work in UK Football Clubs. A lot of football supporters need reassurance that this group of workers will be exempted from immigration targets.

attributes.action: Stop High street shops keeping their doors open regardless of the weather.
attributes.background:
Make retail outlets keep their doors routinely closed when premises are heated to reduce the energy (heat) which is currently wasted.
This will reduce the impact on the environment and global warming by reducing as well as significantly reducing operating costs for retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
You would not leave your door open in all weathers at home.
 Legislation exists to improve energy efficiency in new buildings but High street retailers routinely keep external doors open simply as a marketing tool. Automatic door openers offer some benefit but these are often disabled simply to encourage shoppers to enter and buy. Legislation applying to all retailers will provide a level playing field and reduce any perceived marketing benefit which drives the current bad practice.

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: Make 'having somewhere to call home’ affordable again.
attributes.background: Too many people in our country can no longer afford to live comfortably and without unreasonable stress. This is already a crisis and must be addressed NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose the following as a ’starting place’:
- UK house prices should rise in line with the average UK individual wage; regulation should be in place to prevent prices rising in line with what people can borrow.
- Regulation should be in place to ensure that UK average monthly rent for any domestic property does not exceed UK average monthly mortgage payments made by home-owners in similar properties.
- Banks should be heavily taxed for every non-repayment mortgage they issue.

attributes.action: Prime Ministers should explain why they have not implemented their manifesto
attributes.background: Governments regularly never implement manifesto pledges. Create a law that forces The Prime Minister before a General Election to explain to Parliament why pledges have not been implemented as described.
attributes.additional_details: Trust in politicians is at an all time low, people do not believe what they say. This simple law will encourage political parties to create a manifesto that they can realistically implement. I'm tired of politicians broken promises.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: Ban smacking children in the UK
attributes.background: Britain is now one of just four countries in Europe where smacking remains a legal way of disciplining children. Many studies have demonstrated that smacking has no long-term positive impact on children.  Please sign this petition to defend the basic human rights of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many other, more effective, ways to discipline children that do not involve inflicting physical harm on them. 

Smacking should not be regarded as merely a form of discipline; it is assault and it must not be tolerated in this day and age. It is unacceptable that assaulted adults can go to the police, but assaulted children have no form of recourse.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Ban fee paying 'private' schools so admission to all schools is based on merit.
attributes.background: Eton was founded in 1440, over 557 years ago. It is deplorable that we allow these schools to still operate in a society where they are totally out of place. When it comes to education, meritocracy is the most sensible answer. Keep Eton, the facility's, the teachers erase the price tag.
attributes.additional_details: Independent schools in the UK cost on average £13,000 a year per child, or 32.5% of the average two income household. This means that for the average citizen these schools are unfeasible. No wonder 27,000 children attending private schools are not UK citizens. This outrageously outdated system allows the elite to become richer, by granting them better educations. Oxford and Cambridge admit more Etonians each year than applicants from the whole country who qualify for free school meals, showing how these upper class elites can buy their way into life.

attributes.action: Ban smoking in all public places in the UK
attributes.background:
Why are we still breathing in smoke that we know will kill us, even when we've chosen not to?
Those of us who have decided not to smoke, or to give up, are still forced to inhale cigarette smoke every time we go for a walk or take our children to the park or pop to the shops! It's not right!
attributes.additional_details:
Smoking is the primary cause of preventable illness and premature death, accounting for approximately 96,000 deaths a year in the United Kingdom.

Smoking harms nearly every organ of the body and dramatically reduces both quality of life and life expectancy.

The 2010 US Surgeon General report, ‘How Tobacco Smoke Causes Disease’, concludes that “there is no risk-free level of exposure to tobacco smoke, and there is no safe tobacco product".

attributes.action: Make advertising in any form a fake job vacancy a serious offence
attributes.background: common practice within recruitment is to invent vacancies (even in some cases naming a real Company) to increase the number of CV's a recruitment agency has on file.  This completely wastes job-seekers time, effort, gives them false hope and distracts them from the real task of getting a job

attributes.action: Urgent review of Royal Navy capabilities, with immediate action on results.
attributes.background:
The Harrier Jet was scrapped by the UK in 2010, (USA will scrap them in 2025). Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
The replacement will enter service possibly in 2020.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.
attributes.additional_details:
The Harrier Jump Jet was scrapped in 2010 (USA will scrap them in 2025).  Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
No replacement has yet entered service. The MOD accountants have left this once great Maritime Nation defenceless. Utter madness to dispose of essential defence equipment before the replacement has been thoroughly trialled and allowed to enter service.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.

attributes.action: Halt the rise in Southern train fares until the end of the strikes
attributes.background: The strike by ASLEF and RMT has severely affected the quality of the service on Southern Rail and it could be argued that the price of the rail fare should not be increased until such a time when negotiations between Southern Rail and the Unions reach a close.

attributes.action: Introduce stricter laws & screening on people receiving benefits/social housing
attributes.background: Taxpayers contribute to the upkeep of social housing and benefits system. Many people on benefits abuse the system and many people living in council properties actually let the property out or do not look after / damage the property which then will have to be repaired and paid for by taxpayers.
attributes.additional_details: Experience in construction industry.

attributes.action: The Government immediately brings the Crime and Courts Act 2013 s.40 into force.
attributes.background: Parliament enacted s.40(6) “This section does not apply until such time as a body is first recognised as an approved regulator”. IMPRESS is an approved regulator. Secretaries of State say, ‘The time is not yet right’. Further consultation defies the will of Parliament: an abuse of government power.
attributes.additional_details:
If a TV/radio programme treats you unfairly and/or unwarrantably infringes your privacy, you have a right to complain to the independent Ofcom.  The Press should also be accountable without costs risk to the complainant: but they continue to complain and lobby!
See: IMPRESS http://tinyurl.com/zcy5q36
HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/jag72kt for positive views and rebuttal of Press claims and the merits of IPSO.
Voices of victims  HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/j7wuvgk and http://tinyurl.com/zxhvrr3

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid £810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a housing crisis and something needs to desperately be done such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
Give Bursaries/reduce restrictions on brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies; This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

That each development must have a specified % of council, affordable,  single-living & various bedroom houses available, so to meet the needs of the whole community.

A law that after a developer has received their planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build.

attributes.action: Ban the Broadcasting of Animal Abuse for Entertainment on Television
attributes.background: This petition calls for the government to place a ban on the broadcasting on television of animal abuse for the purposes of entertainment. It would not include other reasons - such as for charitable and educational purposes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for individuals or businesses to own more than 3 houses.
attributes.background: I can understand having second, even third homes but the property market is out of control and will continue to be so given the economic environment we live in. The damage here is to social mobility, community, growing inequality and to people who are low-medium skilled.
attributes.additional_details:
I see no appropriate or logical reason to own multiple (I.e more than 3). There is no justifiable reason that I can see. 

Business will get around this so there will need to be incredibly tight restrictions on commercial properties and a rigorous approach to those looking to bypass the law.

attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: The UK should follow Sweden, cut VAT for fixing goods rather than throwing away.
attributes.background: To combat its ‘throwaway consumer culture’, Sweden has announced tax breaks on repairs to clothes, bicycles, fridges and washing machines. Repairs are more labour-intense than production, which is largely automised, repairs actually contribute to an expanding labour market decreasing unemployment.
attributes.additional_details:
Jobs would be in the U.K. not abroad, they would be where you live & benefit the local economy.  Whereas large-scale manufacturing is very centralised. This will expand the number of companies giving these kinds of services so It’ll be easier for consumers to have things repaired.

It will be easier for people to buy high-quality products because they know it’s affordable to have them fixed if something breaks, giving an  incentive not to buy as cheap as possible and then scrap something.

attributes.action: Improve the treatment of asylum seekers and immigrants coming to the UK.
attributes.background: We believe that with help and support provided by the state asylum seekers and refugees can become just as much of as an asset to the UK. However, the treatment of these vulnerable individuals can only be changed through a shift in the Government's rhetoric and a change in British attitudes.
attributes.additional_details: Over the years the Government and the UK's attitudes towards asylum seekers and refugees have increasingly become more negative. The rhetoric that is pushed is one that pushes the idea of foreigners being somehow less valuable than those native to this country. We call on the Government to revisit and improve current policy.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to breed dogs without being a registered breeder
attributes.background: It should be illegal to breed dogs unless you are a breeder registered on some sort of national register in order to stop people breeding dogs for the wrong reasons and purely for financial gain. It would also help prevent the horrific treatment and breeding in these 'puppy farms'
attributes.additional_details: A national register of breeders should be produced with them all being regulated my a body of animal welfare officers. Anyone breeding outside of these registers should be prosecuted and liable to an unlimited fine.

attributes.action: Create a report on cannabis legalisation worldwide
attributes.background:
Cannabis is being legalised and regulated worldwide, for recreational and medicinal use.

We need a full, detailed report which uses up to date science on any health benefits from cannabis and that also looks at the varying models of regulation of cannabis worldwide.

attributes.action: Charge bus pass users 50p per single trip equating to £1 per return journey.
attributes.background: My husband and I are both pensioners but are not, by any means, "wealthy". Like most pensioners we appreciate a free bus pass but feel that a minimal charge each time we travel is not going to cause hardship. The money generated by this small charge could go towards desperate road repairs locally.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for state schools by 2020.
attributes.background: With the recent increase of funding for grammar schools (£200 million), it is only fair that state schools are also funded since it will affect approximately 93% of the British school children which is 11.7 million. £54 billion is spent on state schools which is around 10.8% of total spending
attributes.additional_details: Please think of your children and or future children.

attributes.action: Increase the age to play the lottery from 16 to 18 the same as other gambling.
attributes.background: I have seen how gambling affects people. A 16 year old could buy a ticket and win millions. This could be dangerous, it could cause them to go off the rails.They could get in with the wrong crowd and be led into a life of drink and drugs.  This amount of money should be with adult supervision.
attributes.additional_details: You have to be 18 to gamble in this country, for example fruit machines, betting shops and casinos. Why is the lottery any different?

attributes.action: Make teaching 'Children's Rights' compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: There are a list of more than 40 rights, which each child has. Most children don't even know these rights exist. Teaching children's rights in schools will inform all children of the rights they have.

attributes.action: To stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.background: As part of my citizenship coursework, I am doing a campaign around stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998 and having the law replaced with the British Bill of Rights.

attributes.action: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws.
attributes.background: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws....
attributes.additional_details:
The Government of Sierra Leone cracks down heavily on peaceful protests. It has become illegal to protest the injustices in the country without a police clearance. This is contrary to democracy and free speech. We, the people, hardly ever get the police clearance to voice our concerns. When we do, our voices are highly censored. We face hot water canons, live ammunition and police batons if we dare to protest without a police clearance. 
The UK Government gives a significant amount of aid to the Sierra Leonean government on the basis of it practicing democratic principles. Denying us the right to protest is undemocratic in every aspect. Cutting aid funds until they revisit those provisions that suppress free speech will force them into a civil dialogue with the people they ought to serve.

attributes.action: Regulate & cap the rent prices in London (RRR)
attributes.background: It's time for the government to take responsibility and stop ignoring their broken system. They should regulate and cap rent prices for rooms at the maximum of £550pcm. We want Responsibility, Regulation and Results (RRR).
attributes.additional_details:
Amongst all of the city wonders  London is known for its extremely high living costs - not to mention the extortionate prices private landlords are charging tenants. 

Due to inflation and low wages some Londoners are forced to work more than one job solely to pay the rent. 
 A lot of these landlords are illegally renting rooms and do not declare the income they are receiving from tenants and are charging tenants anything from £500-£850 for box rooms that can only fit a bed- this need to change!

attributes.action: Enact a British Bill of Rights before BrExit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU must not leave a vacuum in safeguarding human rights, employment rights and other concerns for British citizens, facing fresh challenges to freedom, rights and duties in the 21st century. No major world power functions without a clear constitution. British citizens deserve clarity,
attributes.additional_details:
Britain's unwritten Constitution: https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/britains-unwritten-constitution
The UK Constitution; A summary with options for reform: https://www.parliament.uk/documents/commons-committees/political-and-constitutional-reform/The-UK-Constitution.pdf
Crowdsourcing A UK Constitution; costs and benefits: http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/constitutionuk/2014/03/10/crowdsourcing-a-uk-constitution-costs-and-benefits/

attributes.action: Make Business Studies, Life Skills and Politics mandatory at Secondary School.
attributes.background: In school there is no direct focus on skills that children need to truly succeed in life. Business Studies is taken an optional subject when really we should be teaching our children how to be entrepreneurial, this would help children gain essential critical thinking skills to help them grow.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much opportunity that is potentially being wasted by not equipping children with the skills and knowledge to get on in life. Children should have a knowledge of politics, business, how to get a mortgage. Children should know who the Prime Minister of this country is and how laws are made. If we want our country to be set up for success we should invest in our children as they will invest in the country themselves.

attributes.action: Stop stereotyping teenagers by making national citizen service compulsory
attributes.background: We are a group of teenagers who feel like we are stereotyped frequently, such as being followed in shops, being stopped and searched in groups, seen as criminals and thugs, this makes us feel on edge and ashamed to be called a teenager. We feel our aim will make society a better place, aged 16-18.
attributes.additional_details: Our research found that often terms used to describe teenagers were "hoodies, louts, heartless, evil, frightening, scum, monsters, inhumane and threatening."

attributes.action: Total life Ban if caught using hand held mobile phone
attributes.background: If caught using a hand held mobile phone for talking or texting you should be given a total life time ban from driving.

attributes.action: Repeal  the Health and Social Care Bill.
attributes.background: This bill has signed the death knell for the NHS as we knew it. It has allowed private companies to cherry pick via tender the most lucrative parts of the system. This can not be allowed to continue. The NHS should be there for all.

attributes.action: Call on the Government not to spend further public money on the Olympic stadium.
attributes.background:
The original structure became the new home of West Ham United from last August. The conversion costs £272m, of which the football club will pay just £15m plus annual rent of £2.5m, bringing the final price tag to £702m. 

Problems with the seating will now cost the tax payer more millions to fix
attributes.additional_details: The government preferred to produce a brief for an athletics only stadium which would be largely disassembled after the games with the lower tier remaining in place as a permanent athletics facility to replace the Crystal Palace National Sports Centre. With the original Olympic design finalised and being built, the government had a change of heart and a bidding process for a multi-sport post-Olympic legacy was launched.

attributes.action: Change the way child maintenance payments are assessed and calculated.
attributes.background:
Currently the child maintenance system is calculated on a percentage based on what the paying parent earns.
https://www.gov.uk/how-child-maintenance-is-worked-out/how-the-child-maintenance-service-works-out-child-maintenance
attributes.additional_details: parents should contribute to what it costs to raise a child and not a percentage of their wage. Many find ways to avoid paying child maintenace due to the current calculation.Many receiving abuse the system and spend the income on other stuff other than the child. There should be a national avg amount calculated of what it costs to bring up a child and this amount should be split equally between the parents minus any child benefits the mother received and should be based on the age of the child.
